repnme.cdata!:
Morocco - Second Agricultural Sector
            Investment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            unsatisfactory, with substantial negligible objectives,
            concerning irrigation costs recovery, output pricing, and,
            public expenditure priorities. However, the project was
            successful in moving the agricultural policy agenda forward.
            The Bank failed to deliver appropriate preparation and
            supervision of the project, due to several staff changes,
            making a sustained dialogue difficult. Conversely, the
            performance of the borrower was marginally satisfactory, in
            that, policy reforms and project actions, "owned'
            by the borrower, were accomplished with diligence and
            method. Regardless of the outcome, it is worth noting that
            most of the reform program was implemented, thus providing a
            positive impact for future rural sector development. The
            lessons learned show that project objectives need to be
            realistic, clearly defined, and above all, agreed upon with
            the borrower. Sector or sub-sector investment operations
            need a coherent focus on policy and institutional reforms,
            with increased participation by the borrower in its
            formulation. Systematic measures for development and impact
            indicators, need to be in place, specifically, at the design
            stage (mandatory in Bank projects since 1997). Procurement
            practices, disbursement procedures and auditing, need to be
            addressed early on, and explicitly agreed with the borrower.
            Finally, a sustained dialogue is paramount for a successful operation.

18218262.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Morocco - Second Agricultural Sector
            Investment Loan (ASIL II)

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the Second
            Agricultural Investment Loan Project (ASIL II) will be to
            support a well-conceived investment program in
            Morocco's agricultural sector. The ASIL II will finance
            specific critical investments in: agricultural education,
            livestock, crop production, plant protection, land policy
            programs, rainfed land improvements, forestry, extension,
            small- and medium- scale irrigation, and planning. The loan
            will also finance an Agricultural Development Fund (FDA)
            which promotes private investments in: land improvements;
            irrigation improvements; increased use of small-scale farm
            equipment; livestock intensification; phyto-sanitary
            protection; and increased tree planting. The package of
            policy actions includes: a) liberalization of internal and
            external trade; b) reforms in the budget execution process;
            and c) reforms of the FDA; and d) subsectoral reforms. The
            ASIL II will also support the establishment of an
            Environmental Management Unit which will have the
            responsibility for undertaking environmental screening of
            projects, arranging for environmental impact assessments
            when appropriate, and monitoring impact results from investments.
